alert.note: Alert for Adair; Casey; Russell; Taylor (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 11:16PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Russell, southeastern Taylor, southern Casey and northeastern Adair Counties through 1145 PM EDT/1045 PM CDT/... At 1116 PM EDT/1016 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northeast of Columbia, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Russell, southeastern Taylor, southern Casey and northeastern Adair Counties, including the following locations... Christine, Windsor, Teddy, Webbs Cross Roads, Sano, Gilpin, Cantown, Decatur, Evans Ford and Honey Acre. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
